snippet: A new report criticizes an often confusing and expensive system that creates barriers to receiving care, even as a record number of young people now have insurance....
abstract: New study by nonprofit Children's Health Fund finds quarter of American children lack essential health care; even when covered by Medicare or private insurance, families often struggle to gain access to physicians or to meet costs of deductibles and medication.
lead_paragraph: A new report criticizes an often confusing and expensive system that creates barriers to receiving care, even as a record number of young people now have insurance.

headline.main: Many Insured Children Lack Essential Health Care, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Study Says Many Insured Children Lack Essential Care

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
